review: metroidvania with a side of word salad
enjoyable metroidvania a bit slow compared to some other games but not bad

iconoclasts is a fine action game but a poor metroidvania  exploration is near nonexistent and many of the systems such as the tweaks feel halfbaked i stuck it out because the game was trying hard to tell a compelling story but in the end that goal was too often tripped up by clunky hamfisted dialogue

not very memorable and during the half point of the game i forced my self to play through it iconoclasts was decent but not for full price i suggest waiting for a sale if you want to try it or just not purchasing it

awesome game i had a religious childhood where i was mainly just a quiet observer having robin be a silent but very expressive protagonist was an amazing choice   mr sandberg please make another classic im excited to see more of your work

amazing art great gameplay compelling story i dont why but i like this game a lot enough to play it 3 times its very charming royal my goat

reasonably difficult game where quickclever problem solving is more important to reflexes story is a little bit simplistic but the characters are interesting and complex all in all very good for a 2d platformer with solid game design

i love it its my second favorite game of all time   i just wish i had the drive to get all achievements

this is a modern vintage classic style of a game i absolutely love the game play and have bought the game on many systems i love it the most on ps vita but im sure i will also love it on the pc thanx so much for providing this game to us what a passion project and a modern classic that will never go out of style

the game is good you can clearly see the maximum level of love and the detail put into the game  i completely recommend it  the only problem is the story begin too confusing and it doesnt explain shit and the final boss is an ultimate  in the story and i dont see that as a good thing in general  i am tired of confusing stories that want the player to think about it too much or figure things out

surprisingly depressing it really takes you through a journey that i wouldnt recommend for everyone depending on mental fragility but if you want to fight to save the world and are okay with fighting through some personal darkness dig in its a good game and certainly worth the time

a true classic of the metroidvania genre narration is top notch with interesting characters to follow and a very good world building antagonists like agent black chrome mother or the final boss are very well written  this is a must play if you are a fan of the genre

iconoclasts is a good but flawed metroidvania with a heavy emphasis on puzzle platforming the character writing is rather sloppy which hurts the impact of what should be a story with pretty high stakes and some interesting themes the tweak system also isnt really interesting enough to feel like a good reward for exploration pixel art and boss design is a highlight as expected from dev konjak
